name: Aloo Paratha
steps: Boil potatoes until tender and mash them well
Mix mashed potatoes with finely chopped onion, green chili, coriander leaves, salt, and cumin powder
Knead wheat flour with water and a pinch of salt to make soft dough
Roll dough into small circles, place potato filling in center
Seal edges and roll again carefully into a flat paratha
Cook on hot tawa with oil/ghee until golden brown spots appear on both sides
Serve hot with fresh curd, pickle, or butter

name: Kadhi Pakora
steps: Mix besan with curd, turmeric, and salt to make smooth kadhi batter
Make pakoras by mixing besan with chopped onions, salt, and spices, then deep fry
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and fenugreek seeds
Add ginger-green chili paste and sauté briefly
Pour kadhi mixture and bring to boil, then simmer on low heat for 20 minutes
Add fried pakoras to the kadhi and simmer for 5 more minutes
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with steamed rice

name: Rajma Chawal
steps: Soak rajma overnight, then pressure cook with salt until soft
Cook basmati rice separately and keep aside
Heat oil in pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and cook until tomatoes break down
Add cooked rajma with its water, garam masala, and simmer for 15 minutes
Adjust consistency and seasoning, garnish with coriander
Serve hot rajma over steamed rice with onion slices and pickle

name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then blend to smooth puree
Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry until golden, set aside
Heat oil in pan, add cumin seeds
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and cook until soft
Add spinach puree, salt, and garam masala, simmer for 10 minutes
Gently add paneer cubes and cream, cook for 5 minutes
Serve hot with roti or naan and a dollop of butter

name: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight, then pressure cook until soft
For bhature, mix wheat flour, curd, salt, baking powder, and oil to make soft dough
Heat oil in pan, add cumin and coriander seeds
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes
Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and cook until soft
Add cooked chickpeas with water, garam masala, amchur, and simmer for 20 minutes
Roll bhature dough into circles and deep fry until puffed and golden
Serve hot chole with crispy bhature, onion slices, and pickle

name: Dal Tadka
steps: Wash toor dal and pressure cook with turmeric and salt until mushy
Heat ghee in pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds
Add asafoetida, chopped ginger, garlic, and green chilies
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent
Add tomatoes, red chili powder, and cook until soft
Add cooked dal and adjust consistency with water
Simmer for 10 minutes, adjust seasoning
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or roti

name: Aloo Gobi
steps: Cut potatoes and cauliflower into medium pieces
Heat oil in pan, add cumin seeds
Add potato pieces and fry until half cooked
Add cauliflower florets and mix well
Add turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and mix
Cover and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally
Add chopped onions, tomatoes, ginger, and green chilies
Cook uncovered until vegetables are tender and lightly browned
Sprinkle garam masala and fresh coriander, serve hot with roti

name: Masala Dosa
steps: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours with fenugreek seeds
Grind to smooth batter and ferment overnight
For filling, boil potatoes and mash coarsely
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves
Add chopped onions, ginger, green chilies, and sauté
Add mashed potatoes, turmeric, salt, and mix well
Heat dosa pan, spread batter in thin layer
Drizzle oil around edges and cook until golden
Add potato filling, fold dosa, and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Bhindi Masala
steps: Wash and dry okra completely, then cut into small pieces
Heat oil in pan and fry okra pieces until crispy, remove and set aside
In same pan, add cumin seeds
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes
Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder
Cook until tomatoes break down and oil separates
Add fried okra, garam masala, amchur, and salt
Mix gently and cook for 5 minutes, garnish with coriander

name: Poha
steps: Rinse poha in water until soft, drain and set aside
Heat oil in pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds
Add peanuts and fry until lightly golden
Add curry leaves, chopped ginger, and green chilies
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent
Add diced potatoes, turmeric, salt, and cook until potatoes are done
Add drained poha and mix gently
Cook for 2-3 minutes, sprinkle lemon juice
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot

name: Samosa
steps: Make dough with wheat flour, oil, and water, knead well and rest
Boil potatoes and green peas, mash potatoes coarsely
Heat oil, add cumin and coriander seeds
Add chopped onions, ginger, green chilies, and sauté
Add mashed potatoes, peas, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt
Mix well and let filling cool completely
Roll dough into oval shapes, cut in half to make cones
Fill cones with potato mixture and seal edges with water
Deep fry samosas until golden brown and crispy
Serve hot with mint chutney and tamarind chutney

name: Upma
steps: Dry roast semolina in a pan until lightly golden and aromatic
Heat oil in pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, chana dal, and urad dal
Add curry leaves, chopped ginger, and green chilies
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent
Add 3 cups of water and salt, bring to boil
Gradually add roasted semolina while stirring continuously to avoid lumps
Cook on low heat for 5-7 minutes until water is absorbed
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot
Can be served with coconut chutney or pickle
